response: "{ \"title\": \"Counting Triangles\", \"description\": \"A triangle is a 2D shape with three sides. A triangle is considered equilateral if all its sides have the same length, and isosceles if at least two of its sides have the same length. Write a function `count_triangles` that takes a list of integers as input, where each integer represents the length of one side of a triangle.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef count_triangles(sides: List[int]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `sides` (List[int]): A list of three integers representing the lengths of the sides of a triangle.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the number of triangles that can be formed with the given side lengths, considering only equilateral and isosceles triangles.\\n\", \"code\": \"from typing import List\\n\\ndef count_triangles(sides: List[int]) -> int:\\n    # Sort the sides in ascending order\\n    sides.sort()\\n    # Initialize a counter for the number of triangles\\n    triangle_count = 0\\n    # Check if the sides can form an equilateral triangle\\n    if sides[0] == sides[1] == sides[2]:\\n        triangle_count += 1\\n    # Check if the sides can form an isosceles triangle\\n    elif sides[0] == sides[1] or sides[1] == sides[2] or sides[0] == sides[2]:\\n        triangle_count += 1\\n    return triangle_count\", \"tests\": [\"assert count_triangles([3, 3, 3]) == 1\", \"assert count_triangles([4, 5, 6]) == 1\", \"assert count_triangles([10, 20, 30]) == 0\"] }"
